page.title: 08The Shopping Centre cont.
page.content: ll were on holiday, l9 had come to do their shopping, 3 worked in Thirsk, and l was visiting friends. Most people who live in Thirsk had walked or cycled to the centre. The others had all used cars, except one who had come by train. People who live in Thirsk go to places such as York, Middlesbrough, Northallerton and Ripon to buy most of their larger articles e.g. furniture. We think there are quite a lot of shops here, considering that Thirsk is not very large. It is probably because a lot of people come in from the villages around, and also because there are a lot of tourists. A good trade is done from them. There are about 5O market stalls on Mondays and 3O on Saturdays. Type of stalls: fruit, clothes, shoes, plants, toffee, tools, vans sell fish.
